shields.name: Carbon shield, commercial
shields.description: This durable yet lightweight defensive plate comes in a variety of shapes and sizes, and it’s often customized with LED displays that broadcast personal insignia or an organization’s colors and symbols.

shields.name: Compact shield, commercial
shields.description: This sleek shield is a favorite of operatives and other mobile combatants. It’s most common design is a polycarbon panel contoured to fit snugly over a forearm or other limb.

shields.name: Deflecting field, commercial
shields.description: This shield isn’t held—instead, it’s installed as an armor or weapon upgrade. A deflecting field appears as a translucent panel integrated into the upgraded item and creates a temporary protective hardlight barrier when activated.

shields.name: Irising shield, commercial
shields.description: An irising shield is made of flexible polycarbon with a retractable design. When retracted, an irising shield looks like a decorative bangle, gauntlet, or glove. When deployed, its panels flare out and form a miniature circular shield.

shields.name: Mobile bulwark, commercial
shields.description: This bulky shield is advertised as the ultimate protection in battle for those strong enough to hoist them. Mobile bulwarks create an iconic rectangular silhouette. *Getting the higher AC bonus (+4) requires using the Take Cover action while the shield is raised.

shields.name: Phase shield, commercial
shields.description: A phase shield is an intricate but durable technological device often worn strapped to a limb or belt that projects a protective hardlight barrier when deployed. Phase shields are translucent and tinted, with a wide variety of fully customizable colors and image projectors.

shields.name: Riot shield, commercial
shields.description: Riot shields are constructed from sheets of transparent aluminum reinforced with nanocarbon panels layered over polymers or resins. *Getting the higher AC bonus (+4) requires using the Take Cover action while the shield is raised.
